chairs.name: Djinn Chair
chairs.Make: Tubular steel frame, foam padding, and nylon jersey upholstery
chairs.description: Organic, futuristic design. Seemingly cut and folded from a single piece of material. Mourgue designed this chair at 24 years old. It's design for lounging rather than something formal reflected the more relaxed events of the 1960s.

chairs.name: President Lounge Chair
chairs.description: Famously seen in Star Trek III: The Search for Spock.

chairs.name: A-line Chairs
chairs.description: The A-line Chair was the first chair ever made by moulded injection in one piece.

chairs.name: Tube Chair
chairs.Make: Four hollow cylinders in PVC, foam rubber, and leather
chairs.description: The modular components of this chair can be arranged in any combination to suit the user, and can even be nested together, one inside the other. The chair is made up entirely of synthetic materials, reflecting an increased interest in man-made materials in domestic environments that became popular at this time.

Electronic Appliances.name: KD29
Electronic Appliances.description: The KD29 lamp's original rounded shape lights up and is mounted on a thin band recreating a “zero-gravity” effect. This lamp offers light and has a tray for pens and small office equipment.

Electronic Appliances.name: Model 540P
Electronic Appliances.description: Lightweight plastic sphere emits a warm glow atop an elegant slender, chrome-plated tube. Chrome plated, dew drop form base.

Electronic Appliances.name: Dania
Electronic Appliances.description: The Diana, a sculptural and organic model, was forged in one piece cast aluminium painted white

Electronic Appliances.name: Keracolor Keraclonic Sphere
Electronic Appliances.description: The Keracolor's design was thought of in 1968, which defines it as a product of sixties modernism, but did not actually go on sale until late 1970. Its spherical shape reminiscent of a cosmonaut’s helmet, a pure example of space-age design.

Electronic Appliances.name: RR126
Electronic Appliances.designed by: Pier Giacomo Castiglioni and Achille Castiglioni
Electronic Appliances.Make: Plywood covered with a white plastic laminate
Electronic Appliances.description: The RR126 was one of the most famous designs in the history of Italian home stereo, and became a status symbol as soon as it was released in 1966. Its modular speakers could be hung on either side of the record player or disconnected to sit on the floor or any surface. Though it was beautifully symmetric, minimalism was not the factor that set the RR126 apart from the others on this list. Quite the opposite. This unit was anthropomorphized with volume dials for eyes and speakers for ears

Electronic Appliances.name: Eclipse
Electronic Appliances.description: Joe Colombo Eclipse Space Age Table Lamp for Lightolier, circa 1960s. Orange lacquered metal exterior with a white inside and a rotating screen in the center allows you to control the amount of light and create and 'eclipse' effect as you rotate the button on the top of the lamp.

Electronic Appliances.name: Seiko Flip Clocks
Electronic Appliances.description: The Seiko Brand was marketed toward the Japanese market. Throughout the sixties, seiko managed to put out an asortment of colorful flip clocks with imaginative forms. Pictured is the Seiko DP 602 Pedestal Clock.

Storage/Tables.name: Componibili
Storage/Tables.description: Anna Castelli Ferrieri was an Italian architect and designer, one of the first Italian women graduated in architecture and one of the few women in the design sector in those years. She is known for her collaboration with Kartell, a company founded by her husband in 1949 and a pioneer in Italy in research and production of everyday plastic objects.

Storage/Tables.name: Bobby Cabinet
Storage/Tables.description: Joe Colombo is known for his many unique designs, in which convenience and effective design were paramount. That's why many of his designs were light and easy to take apart for cleaning.

Storage/Tables.name: Tulip Dining Room Set
Storage/Tables.Make: Tulip Table base is made from cast Aluminium and is painted white, the top is made from white Formica
Storage/Tables.description: Tulip bases made for an icon of the '60s. Their imaginative forms and bright colours came to suggest the spirit of the moment, adding an exciting twist to the rational interior concept of design.
